  Source   Edit

Play audio in voice channel via ytdl/ffmpeg.

Imports

objects, constants

Types

VoiceOp = enum
  Identify = 0, SelectProtocol = 1, Ready = 2, Heartbeat = 3,
  SessionDescription = 4, Speaking = 5, HeartbeatAck = 6, Resume = 7, Hello = 8,
  Resumed = 9, ClientDisconnect = 13

Disconnects a voice client.   Source   Edit 
proc pause(v: VoiceClient): owned(Future[void]) {....raises: [Exception],
    tags: [RootEffect].}
Pause the current audio   Source   Edit 
proc play(v: VoiceClient; input: Stream | Process; waitForData: int = 100000): owned(
    Future[void])
Plays audio data that comes from a stream or process. Audio must be 2 channel, 48k sample rate, PCM encoded byte stream. Make sure to use sendSpeaking before sending any audio
  • waitForData: How many milliseconds to allow for data to start coming through
  Source   Edit 
proc playFFMPEG(v: VoiceClient; path: string): owned(Future[void]) {.
    ...raises: [Exception], tags: [ReadDirEffect, ReadEnvEffect, ReadIOEffect,
                                ExecIOEffect, RootEffect, WriteIOEffect,
                                TimeEffect].}
Gets audio data by passing input to ffmpeg (so input can be anything that ffmpeg supports). Requires ffmpeg be installed.   Source   Edit

                                TimeEffect].}
